intro: Henckelia inaequalifolia, commonly known as the unequal-leaved henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often unequal in size, giving it its specific epithet. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
